content: Act as a helpful AI assistant
In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Sure, here is a simple function in Julia that does that:

```julia
function wrap_string(text::String, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(text)
    current_line_length = 0
    wrapped_text = ""

    for word in words
        if current_line_length + length(word) > text_width
            wrapped_text *= "\n"
            current_line_length = 0
        end
        if current_line_length != 0
            wrapped_text *= " "
            current_line_length += 1
        end
        wrapped_text *= word
        current_line_length += length(word)
    end

    return wrapped_text
end
```

You can use this function like this:

```julia
text = "This is a very long string that we want to wrap"
wrapped_text = wrap_string(text, 10)
println(wrapped_text)
```

This will output:

```
This is a
very long
string that
we want to
wrap
```
